alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 5:38AM EST until January 11 at 10:12PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Connecticut... Yantic River near Yantic affecting New London County. For the Yantic River...including Yantic...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Yantic River near Yantic. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:31 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:31 AM EST Wednesday was 13.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.1 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 09/21/1938. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Yantic River Yantic 9.0 13.5 Wed 5 am EST 7.4 4.6 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 545 PM EST.
